page.title: 02The Bishop of Peterborough
page.content: I write this from one of the few houses in England called a Palace, where my predecessors, the Abbots and Bishops of Peterborough, have lived in unbroken line from before the first Domesday Book. Parts of my home were built in the year 1200 and every century since has brought something new. Living here is like living inside history. The new communities built around this ancient centre are in a long tradition of building and renewal which has characterised this city, and the giant Cathedral, our neighbour, is in a similar tradition, that of an ever-renewing faith, which has been here for 1300 years and which still has significance in the lives of many. If there is anyone reading this _ for we are pessimists in the 1980s _ well, I wish you a history and a faith for your time. {+ William Petriburg
